(1, 1, 1): Hallowe'en, Allhallowe'en, All Hallows' Eve, All Saints' Eve,
(2, 1, 1): Western Christians and many non-Christians around the world
(4, 1, 1): Trick-or-treating, costume parties, making jack-o'-lanterns, lighting bonfires, divination, apple bobbing, visiting haunted attractions
(5, 1, 1): Church services, prayer, fasting, and vigil
(7, 1, 1): Totensonntag, Blue Christmas, Thursday of the Dead, Samhain, Hop-tu-Naa, Calan Gaeaf, Allantide, Day of the Dead, Reformation Day, All Saints' Day, Mischief Night (cf. vigil)
